title: Materialists
summary: Materialists (2025) follows Lucy, a wealthy and ambitious New York art dealer whose life takes an unexpected turn when she starts working with a charming professional matchmaker. As she navigates the world of elite dating, Lucy finds herself torn between love, status, and the idea of what truly makes a relationship meaningful.
story: Lucy Mason is successful, confident, and deeply entrenched in New York’s luxury art scene. After a sudden breakup shakes her foundation, she crosses paths with a charismatic matchmaker who introduces her to a system based on emotional intelligence rather than wealth or aesthetics. While helping others find love, Lucy becomes caught between her polished, material-driven lifestyle and the sincere, unexpected connection she begins to form with the matchmaker. As their relationship grows, Lucy must confront her own fear of vulnerability and decide whether she is willing to give up the world she knows for something real.
details: Materialists (2025) is a romantic comedy-drama directed and written by Celine Song. The film blends humor, emotion, and commentary on class and modern relationships, featuring performances from Dakota Johnson, Chris Evans, and Pedro Pascal. Produced by A24, the film focuses on authenticity, character-driven storytelling, and intimate New York settings.
awards: No confirmed awards or nominations as of now.

production.title: Produced By
production.value: David Hinojosa, Christine Vachon, Pamela Koffler, Celine Song

locations.title: New York City, USA
locations.sub: Manhattan (Cooper Union, West Village, Midtown), Brooklyn (Brooklyn Heights, Sunset Park), Saint Bartholomew’s Episcopal Church, Lotte New York Palace, JW Marriott Essex House, Plaza Hotel

timeline.text: Project announced in February 2024; Celine Song confirmed as writer-director, and Dakota Johnson, Chris Evans, Pedro Pascal attached.
Sony Pictures acquires international distribution rights in February 2024.
Additional cast announced in May 2024 (Zoë Winters, Dasha Nekrasova, Louisa Jacobson, Marin Ireland).
Principal photography begins on April 29, 2024 in New York City.
Filming wraps on June 6, 2024 after shoots in Manhattan, Brooklyn, and Durango (Mexico).
First wide theatrical release on June 13, 2025 in the USA.
International release by Sony Pictures begins August 16, 2025.
Scheduled to begin streaming on HBO Max / Max in November 2025.
